description:
Problem Statement: Municipal Service Request System


Objective:

Develop a console-based C# application using ADO.NET to perform Create, Read, Update operations on a ServiceRequest table in a SQL Server database. The application should enable citizens to submit new municipal service requests, view all matching requests, and update existing requests. The project must use a disconnected architecture with SqlConnection, SqlDataAdapter, and all classes, properties, and methods must be made public.


Database Details:

Database Name: appdb

Table Name: ServiceRequest

Column Name

  • RequestID int Auto-incremented, NOT NULL, Primary Key
  • RequesterName varchar(50)
  • Address varchar(50)
  • ServiceType varchar(50)
  • ContactNumber varchar(50)
  • RequestDate varchar(50) Format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
  • Description varchar(50)

Ensure that the database connection is properly established using the ConnectionStringProvider class.

 

  1. Use the below sample connection string to connect the MsSql Server

 private string connectionString = "User ID=sa;password=examlyMssql@123; server=localhost;Database=appdb;trusted_connection=false;Persist Security Info=False;Encrypt=False";


Note:

Do not change the class names. 

Do not change the skeleton (Structure of the project given)


Folder structure:

Classes and Properties:

ServiceRequest Class (in Models folder):

Represents a citizen's municipal service request entity with the following public properties:


  • RequestID (int): Unique identifier for each request (auto-incremented in DB).
  • RequesterName (string): Name of the citizen making the request.
  • Address (string): Address where the service is requested.
  • ServiceType (string): Type of municipal service requested.
  • ContactNumber (string): Citizenâ€™s contact number.
  • RequestDate (string): Date of request in "yyyy-mm-dd" format.
  • Description (string): Additional request details.


Methods:

AddServiceRequest(ServiceRequest requestObj):

  • Inserts a new request into the ServiceRequest table in the database.
  • Parameters: A ServiceRequest object containing the details of the request to be added.
  • Access Modifier: Public
  • Declaration Modifier: Static
  • Return Type: Void
  • Console Messages:
  • "Service request added successfully."


DisplayAllRequests(string requesterName, string serviceType):

  • Retrieves and displays all requests from the ServiceRequest table which has the same requester name and the service type as given in the input.
  • Parameters: The RequesterName, and a ServiceType.
  • Access Modifier: Public
  • Declaration Modifier: Static
  • Return Type: Void
  • Console Messages:
  • If requests are found: The details of each service request are printed.
  • RequestID: {row["RequestID"]}\tRequesterName: {row["RequesterName"]}\tAddress: {row["Address"]}\tServiceType: {row["ServiceType"]}\tContactNumber: {row["ContactNumber"]}\tRequestDate: {row["RequestDate"]}\tDescription: {row["Description"]}
  • If no requests are found: "No service requests found."


UpdateRequest(int requestID, ServiceRequest updatedRequest):

  • Updates the information of an existing request based on the provided RequestID.
  • Parameters: The RequestID, and a ServiceRequest object with updated details.
  • Access Modifier: Public
  • Declaration Modifier: Static
  • Return Type: Void
  • Console Messages:
  • If the request is successfully updated: "Request details updated successfully."
  • The details of the updated service request are printed.
  • If no request is found: "No request found with ID {requestID}."


Program Class:

The Program class serves as the entry point for the Municipal Service Request System.

  • Main function:(Prompt all the user inputs in the Main function itself)
  • Prompts the user to input service request details.
  • Ensures that no empty or invalid objects are passed as parameters.
  • Handles error messages for invalid input or when attempting an invalid choice.
  • Menu Options: The main menu serves as the user interface for interacting with the system. It provides the following options:

Municipal Service Request System Menu

1. Add Service Request: Prompt all the user inputs and call the AddServiceRequest(ServiceRequest requestObj) method;

2. Update Service Request: Prompt all the user inputs and call the UpdateRequest(int requestID, ServiceRequest updatedRequest) method;

3. Display All Service Requests: Prompts all the user input and call the DisplayAllRequests(string requesterName, string serviceType) method;

4. Exit: Terminates the application with the message "Exiting the application...".

Invalid choice: Displays "Invalid choice, please try again."


Commands to Run the Project:

  • cd dotnetapp - Select the dotnet project folder
  • dotnet restore - This command will restore all the required packages to run the application.
  • dotnet run - To run the application.
  • dotnet build - To build and check for errors
  • dotnet clean - If the same error persists clean the project and build again
  • dotnet add package package_name --version 6.0 - Any package if required you can install by the above command. The package that you are installing should support the .Net 6.0 version.
